definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
"eight" component in Chinese characters/archaic variant of 八[ba1]
one of the characters used in kwukyel, an ancient Korean writing system
half of a game or contest/half-court
half of the day/a long time/quite a while/midair/CL:個|个[ge4]
midnight/in the middle of the night

sentences.english: The big black Bakelite phone rang at half past ten.
sentences.chinese: 十點半的時候，外殼用膠木做的電話響了。

sentences.english: We can measure half a period.
In this semi-successional fermentation, a prolonged period of high rate daily gas production was maintained.
sentences.chinese: 半連續補料能維持較長時間的較高日產氣效率。

sentences.english: The semi-random control trial was conducted.
They were traditionally semisedentary, moving seasonally between fixed sites.
sentences.chinese: 他們是傳統的半定居部落，在定居點間季節性遷移。

sentences.english: In addition, the semi-quantitative analysis by VIDAS image analysis system were carried either.
sentences.chinese: 並用VIDAS圖象分析系統進行半定量分析。

sentences.english: Then the French came up with semi-private jails, in which the state employs only the guards;
sentences.chinese: 之後法國開始出現半私立監獄，即僅由國家僱用守衛。

sentences.english: The physician has gone into semiretirement because of ill health.
sentences.chinese: 這位醫生由於健康不佳已經處於半退休狀態了。

sentences.english: AT seven-thirty Friday evening Scali passed this word along.
sentences.chinese: 星期五晚上七時半，斯卡利把話傳了過去。

sentences.english: The semi-Markov process theory can be used to analyze the reliability of the system on this condition.
sentences.chinese: 但可以利用半馬爾可夫過程理論分析系統的可靠性。

sentences.english: I'm feeling goose bumps now. I was having death threats, I never felt safe for 3 and a half years.
sentences.chinese: 有人恐嚇說要我的命，那三年半我沒有一點兒安全感。

sentences.english: A dual-executive is the central characteristic of semi-presidential systems.
sentences.chinese: 行政體系二元化是半總統制重要的特色之一。

sentences.english: The first semi-autobiographical movie "Miracle Girl" will also be shot in China.
sentences.chinese: 第一部半自傳式的電影“奇蹟少女”也將在國內拍色。

sentences.english: The owners of these experiences recognize them as fragmentary semimemories.
sentences.chinese: 這些過往經歷的主人把它們當作是零碎的半記憶片段。

sentences.english: He usually spends about two and a half years in each zodiac sign.
sentences.chinese: 他通常花近兩方面，每個星座半。

sentences.english: Sorry. It's 3:30 p. m. , our tickets sale is over.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，現在是下午三點半，我們的售票已結束。

definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
almost/nearly/more or less/about the same/good enough/not bad
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
